text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today we are gonna be doing something special
for the holiday season!

One of my favorite treats are the white chocolate
coconut truffle balls!

And, I’ve been playing a lot of League of
Legends and I got a lot of

requests for those cute, little adorable characters,
the little Poros.

They’re white and fluffy and they look like
little coconut balls, and I thought…
Let’s do this!

Today we’re gonna make Coconut Truffle Poros,
let’s get started!

I love this recipe because it doesn’t have
very many ingredients, it’s very

easy to make, and no baking is involved! These
are a refrigeration recipe!

The things you will need, will be: 1 cup of
chopped up white chocolate, you can

use white chocolate chips, you can use white
chocolate melts, or you can use

fancy white chocolate, whatever you’d like.
1 cup of coconut shredded flakes,

1/2 a cup of heavy cream, 1 tablespoon of
vanilla extract, and just some nuts,

whatever you’d like. I am using cashews
because these are my favorite.

Alright, now we are gonna take all of these
ingredients and head over
to the stove, to put ‘em all together!

To start, we’re gonna bring 1 inch of water
to simmer in a medium sized sauce pan,

then place a heat safe bowl on top of the
pan, glass bowls work perfectly for this!

Once the bottom of your glass bowl is warm,
add in your chocolate and stir
together until the chocolate is melted.

Now add in the cream and mix together until
everything is combined.

Stir in your vanilla extract and then remove
from the heat.

Allow the mixture to cool for about a minute
and then add in your 2 cups

of coconut shreds! Mix it all together and
then put the bowl in the refrigerator for
about an hour.

I just took our coconut truffle mixture out
of the fridge, it’s perfect,

it’s chilled, it’s had plenty of time
to get very firm but still a little sticky.

I’m gonna take this tablespoon, and, take
a scoop, and then we’re gonna roll it

into a little ball, hand roll it. There we
go! Perfect!

And, now you’re gonna take your nut, remember
these can be hazelnut, anything
you’d like, I’m using cashews.

And I’m sticking it right in the middle,
covering it up, roll, roll, roll!

And they’re nice and sticky and this is
perfect, because we’re gonna now, dip it into

our shredded coconut, and let it just stick everywhere,
stick, stick, stick, stick!
Ah! You hairy little monster!

And now we’re just gonna make a bunch of
these and stick them onto your

cookie sheet, with a piece of wax paper. And
once we’ve filled this entire cookie

sheet, we’re just gonna put these in the
fridge for about 10 more minutes
to get firm.

While those are chilling in the freezer we
are gonna focus on decorations for our

little Poros! I have strawberry Laffy Taffy’s.
I chose these because they are

the right color pink, and they’re fun and
moldable!

Alright so what you’re gonna do is open it up,
then put your little Laffy Taffy

on a piece of wax paper, because we’re gonna
take a rolling pin and roll it flat!

Once your Laffy Taffy is nice and flat you’re
gonna take a sharp cutting knife

and cut off the two ends, on the top and the
bottom.

And this is awesome because it will make 6
tongues. And you’re gonna take your

baking scissors, or you can just shape it
by hand, whatever you want to do.

And just cut a round tongue shape. And you
can eat the extras! Mmmmm-mmmm!

Once you get all your little tongues cut out,
what you’re gonna do is just take a

toothpick and press it right down the middle
to make the tongue middle line imprint.

I just took the coconut truffles out of the
freezer and I put a few of them on

this little red holiday plate, and now I’m
gonna show you how to put them together

and decorate. So the first thing that we’re
gonna do is put on our little Poro

tongues that we made. So I’m gonna grab this
little tongue over here, I’m gonna
stick him right on the front, perfect!

OK, and now over here, I have a bunch of cashews
that I’ve paired together, so they

look a little similar, and you’re just gonna
take 2 of those, stick it right
on the top, kind of like their little antlers!
Oh my gosh they look so cute!

The last thing that you’re gonna do to decorate
is you’re gonna take black cookie

icing, I put a number 1 tip here at the top,
so it’sthe smallest one I could find,
and we’re just gonna make little Poro eyeballs!

Once you got him all done, look at him, he’s
so cute!
Mewhr hello! Alt-alt-alt-alt-alt-alt pfffft!

Just kidding! That’s a mean thing to do,
don’t do that to your Poros!

OK, now you’re gonna decorate all the rest of
these to look just like this little guy!
Decorate, decorate, decorate, decorate!

Ta-da! Here are our white chocolate Coconut
Truffles that look like little Poros!

They’re so cute, these are perfect for the
holiday season, they’re homemade truffles!
Yum, yum, yum, yum, yum! Yum, yum, yum, yum, yum!

Thanks you guys for suggesting it. This was
such a cute idea. If you have any

other ideas for any other Nerdy Nummies, please
let me know, leave me a comment

down below and I will do my best to make it
happen!

And, you can follow me on Facebook and Twitter,
I post lots of pictures of

Nerdy Nummies creations, and I like to post
fan baking creations!
So if you make any of the things you see on the show, I have a fan folder and I love to post them,
so send me pictures, Facebook, Twitter!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
I’ll eat these, om-nom-nom-nom!

I’m a Poro, I’m a Poro! Little hearts
coming out of my head if you feed me biscuits!
